8 Write ye also for the Jews, as it liketh you, in the king's name, and seal it with the king's ring: for the writing which is written in the king's name, and sealed with the king's ring, may no man reverse.

 9 Then were the king's scribes called at that time in the third month, that is, the month Sivan, on the three and twentieth day thereof; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews, and to the lieutenants, and the deputies and rulers of the provinces which are from India unto Ethiopia, an hundred twenty and seven provinces, unto every province according to the writing thereof, and unto every people after their language, and to the Jews according to their writing, and according to their language.

 10 And he wrote in the king Ahasuerus' name, and sealed it with the king's ring, and sent letters by posts on horseback, and riders on mules, camels, and young dromedaries:
And I sought for a man among them, that should make up the hedge, and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none.
That\'s Alright! Try Again Next Time
Speech is not supported in your Device

First and foremost, welcome to GirdThySword Pro! We are glad that you are here. GirdThySword Pro is a Bible memorization App that uses a memorization technique called spaced repetition based on cognitive science, for effective scheduling of time of review of Bible verses. 
The main purpose of this app is to enable users to memorize the Bible, and at the same time retain what they memorize forever. 

Here is a list of things that you can do in this app: 
1. Add Bible sections to commit to memory from 8 different languages that are built-in to the app. Click the + icon in the 'Home' screen and click on 'Add Section' to add sections. 
2. Review Bible verses through manual feedback or speech. Click on a list item(chunk) in the Dailies tab of the 'Home' screen to review that chunk" 
3. Forge new virtual Swords by memorizing Bible verses, and equip the sword of your choice which is then displayed in the Leaderboard along with your name and number of verses memorized. 
4. Unlock badges in the 'Stats' screen which you can share in any social media of your choice once you've crossed a milestone. 
5. Chat with the global community inorder to network with other like-minded GirdThySword soldiers. Directly chat with the Administrator of the app regarding bugs, feature requests or simply to say Hi. 
6. Read the Bible in one of the coolest Bible readers in the world, with parallel reading support. This means that you can read any two versions of the Bible at the same time. The page navigation is super easy and insanely fast for the amount of power it provides."
I\'m confused. Where do I get an overview?

Bible memorization is a fairly straightforward process. You pick a chapter or a verse, start from the beginning, keep repeating the words in your mind, and the verses start to stick. The same principle is used in this app. 
1. You start by adding a section to memorize, let's say Psalms 23. Since the chapter has 6 verses it is divided into 2 chunks of 3 verses each by default. 
2. You are now first scheduled with the first chunk for review today. You can review it manually or through speech recognition. If you found it easy, then it means you've mastered, which then lets the app know that you've memorized it. 
3. All the chunks(including memorized verses) will be rescheduled after review to a future date(which is dependent on the review score).
TL;DR Add sections to memorize, review the verses that come up in your dailies.
How do I add new sections to memorize?

Press the round + button in the bottom right corner of the home screen. Two options \'Add Section\' and \'Remove Section\' would appear. Press \'Add Section\' and select the section that you want to add. Once done, the section would be broken into chunks of an equal size and the first chunk would appear in your dailies.
How do I know when to review a particular chunk?

All chunks that you have to review show up in your dailies tab. If you want to see when all the chunks are scheduled to, you can take a look at the calendar in the \'Overview\' tab in the Home Screen.
How do I report a bug or request a feature?
You can send a mail to codemercenaries@gmail.com or send a message to the ADMIN in the \'Tavern\'. And of course you can contact the Lead Developer through the social links in the \'About\' screen.

Hey, check out this cool Bible Memorization app that I found. It uses advanced algorithms and speech recognition to help you memorize Bible verses. It also has a leaderboard where you can compare your progress with other users. And guess what, it\'s absolutely free!!\\n\\n\ https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.code.codemercenaries.girdthysword&hl=en
